meanings.definition: A rhythmic throbbing or vibrating movement.
meanings.sent1: The puls of the music filled the room with energy.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the puls of my heart as I ran.
meanings.sent3: The puls of the washing machine made it seem like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The puls of the city never seemed to rest, always alive and moving.
meanings.sent5: The puls of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: To beat or throb in a rhythmic manner.
meanings.sent1: The drums puls softly in the background of the song.
meanings.sent2: His head began to puls with pain after the accident.
meanings.sent3: The engine seemed to puls with excitement as it revved up.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to puls with emotion as she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The dance floor seemed to puls with energy as the music played.
